docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: International A2-A9 Brezhnev's son-in-law is being held in Moscow after his arrest on corruption charges, a Foreign Ministry spokesman said. The son-in-law was a top Interior Ministry official until 1984. docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Child-custody experts believe that the judge in the Baby M case will have to rely on New Jersey custody law and its primary tenet - the ''best interests'' of the child - to resolve the bitter tug-of-war over the 10-month-old girl.

headline.main: BABY M'S 'BEST INTERESTS' MAY RESOLVE A PUZZLING CASE

docs.snippet: LEAD: Child-custody experts believe that the judge in the Baby M case will have to rely on New Jersey custody law and its primary tenet - the ''best interests'' of the child - to resolve the bitter tug-of-war over the 10-month-old girl.

byline.original: By ROBERT HANLEY, Special to the New York Times
